body:
Yes I need to put some metadata caching timeouts in you are right. I'll add it to the list. 

Thanks 

Nick
can you please make the cache timeout value settable?
I'd find it very useful to be able to manually trigger the metadata to be updated, rather than having to wait for the cache to expire.
I'd love to see an default timeout (60s or so), overridden by an option (example: --cache-timeout=10m). Should only affect (x)attr and paths, raw data shouldn't be cached imo  :-)

issue.title: Rclone mount not refreshing directory

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
When doing a 'ls' in a mounted rclone directory following a 'rclone move' none of the new files are shown. I cannot ascertain through the documentation what the expected behaviour is - are users supposed to umount and then remount the directory in order to see the new files or is this refresh mechanism supposed to happen automatically?

I'm on Debian 8, running 1.33, and are using amazon cloud drive with encryption.

The uploads are indeed working as their encrypted counterparts can be seen in the web gui (and also after a remount)

issue.title: on ACD. large files give 504 error. The files appears to be on ACD. Rclone redoes the upload.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
on ACD. large files give 504 error. The files appears to be on ACD. Rclone redoes the upload.

This seems to happen roughly 100% of the time on files of size 10-50GB that I've tested it on so far.
The end result of some files is that they upload fine the first try. Some files will 504 three times and then rclone will exit (it only retries the command three times).... after the third time the file is just on ACD... as far as I can tell all three uploads worked perfectly. While the error message appears almost always on these files the unneeded repetitions only happens maybe 10-20% of the time? or looking over my test files it seems the unneeded repetitions happen always on files greater than 31gb and on files 10-31gb the error message appears but then in the second round the check realizes it doesn't need to repeat and so doesn't.

I'm on ethernet not wireless which is why I didn't just post in this thread: https://github.com/ncw/rclone/issues/183

edit: here's a quote of an exact error of this type:
2015/12/24 20:59:52 gigatribe stuff 1.5.7z.003: Failed to copy: HTTP code 504: "
504 GATEWAY_TIMEOUT", no response body

issue.title: list of files not refreshing when using mount

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hi there,

I'm currently experimenting with rclone and the new mount functionality.
Rclone 1.33 is running in a docker environment (docker alljoysnville/rclone:latest).
The connection to google drive is working fine and I can upload/download file no problem.

The only problem I have is that when I add/remove files on my google drive file list doesn't change in my mounted directory. Only once I unmount and mount the google drive again, the file list will get updated.

here are the commands that I'm running:
`rclone mount gdrive:remoteDirectory path/to/local/ &`
`ls path/to/local` -> this will give me all the files are there.

I then copy a new file into the directory on google drive (e.g. using the web interface or another computer).
Then I look at the list of files in my docker container again. The newly copied file is missing from that list.

If I use `rclone ls gdrive:remoteDirectory` directly, all changes are reflected immediately.

Is there some kind of delay to get this file list updated?

issue.title: Until rclone wont be updating new files/dirs in mount, there is an bash script re-mount idea :)

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Call it blahblah.sh you can also add it into cron when fixed, btw you need to edit it by your paths etc ;)

```
pkill -f "mount"
fusermount -u /_mnt/
umount -f /_mnt/
umount -l /_mnt/
cd ~/rclone/rclone-v1.33-64-gbc414b6-linux-386 && ./rclone mount --no-modtime secret:/FTP/ /home/remoteacd/ &
```

Not works as i expected but you can get idea, anyone can update to get it working, i am too lazy r8 now xD thx! If no-one i will post update/fix soon.

issue.title: Manual trigger of cache flush

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
The updates to fix issue #680 are a huge help to refresh the cache without having to unmount/remount, so thanks for that!

However, it would be very useful to also be able to manually trigger a refresh of the cache in instances where we already know the cache is stale.

Issue #771 discusses having an rclone process you can send commands to; perhaps a refresh/flush command could be implemented if/when that functionality is added?
